intro: Sclerolaena intricata, commonly known as the intricate sclerolaena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Sclerolaena intricata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
